title: Custom Field Type Mappings
design: Allow users to override default Ashâ†’Backpex field type mappings via config.exs. Support global config, app-scoped config, map-based and function-based mappings, with proper precedence and compile-time validation.
acceptance_criteria: All 5 user stories from spec implemented. Backward compatible - existing projects without config work identically. Compile-time errors for invalid configs.

title: Add config reader for field_type_mappings
design: Create helper function to read field_type_mappings from Application config. Check app-scoped config first (config :my_app, AshBackpex, field_type_mappings), then global (config :ash_backpex, field_type_mappings). Return nil if not configured.
acceptance_criteria: Function reads from both config sources with correct precedence. Returns nil when no config exists. Works at compile time.

title: Integrate map-based type lookup into transformer
design: Modify try_derive_module in GenerateBackpex transformer to check custom mappings before the hardcoded case statement. Support both built-in Ash types (Ash.Type.String) and custom type modules (MyApp.Types.Email) as map keys. Explicit DSL module option still takes precedence.
acceptance_criteria: Custom mappings override defaults. Custom Ash types can be mapped. Explicit module in DSL takes precedence over config. Unmapped types fall through to default logic.

title: Add array type mapping support
design: Extend type lookup to handle tuple-style array types like {:array, Ash.Type.String} as mapping keys. When looking up {:array, SomeType}, check for exact match first, then fall back to default array handling.
acceptance_criteria: Can map {:array, Ash.Type.String} to custom field. Scalar and array mappings for same base type work independently. Falls back to default when no array mapping configured.

title: Implement function-based mappings
design: Support field_type_mappings as a function with signature fn type, constraints -> module | nil end. Function receives Ash type and constraints map. Return nil to fall back to defaults. Wrap function calls in try/rescue to catch exceptions and re-raise as compile-time errors with context.
acceptance_criteria: Function-based mapping works with type and constraints args. Returning nil falls back to default. Exceptions are caught and re-raised with helpful context (which field, what error). Invalid return values (not module or nil) raise compile-time error.

title: Add module validation for mapped fields
design: Validate that mapped modules: 1) exist/are compiled (Code.ensure_loaded), 2) implement Backpex.Field behavior (check for behaviour attribute or required callbacks like render/1). Raise helpful compile-time errors with module name and what's wrong.
acceptance_criteria: Non-existent modules raise clear error. Modules not implementing Backpex.Field behavior raise clear error. Valid modules pass validation silently.

title: Add configuration format validation
design: Validate field_type_mappings config value is either a map or a function. Validate map keys are valid Ash type modules or tuple types. Raise compile-time errors with clear instructions for invalid formats.
acceptance_criteria: Invalid config type (not map or function) raises clear error. Invalid map keys raise helpful error. Valid configs pass silently.

title: Write unit tests for config reading and validation
design: Test config reader: global config, app-scoped config, precedence (app over global), missing config returns nil. Test validation: invalid types rejected, invalid map keys rejected, valid configs accepted. Test function-based: exceptions caught, invalid returns caught, nil returns handled.
acceptance_criteria: Full coverage of config reading logic. Full coverage of validation logic. Tests document expected behavior clearly.

title: Write integration tests with LiveResource modules
design: Test full flow: configure mapping, define LiveResource with mapped type, verify generated field uses custom module. Test with SQLite fixtures following existing test patterns. Cover: default override, custom Ash types, array types, function-based mapping, explicit module precedence.
acceptance_criteria: Integration tests verify end-to-end behavior. Tests use existing fixture patterns. All user story acceptance scenarios covered.

title: Update documentation for custom field mappings
design: Document in module docs and README: configuration options (global vs app-scoped), precedence rules (explicit > app-scoped > global > default), map format, function format with signature, examples for common use cases (custom RichText, Money fields, custom Ash types).
acceptance_criteria: Config options documented with examples. Precedence rules clearly explained. Common use cases shown. Matches SC-004 from spec.
